feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:04AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Rising Rivers This Weekend... Heavy rainfall is expect tonight and Saturday across the Central and Eastern Brooks Range. This will cause rising water levels on streams and rivers draining the Central and Eastern Brooks Range this weekend. Rainfall totals of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are expected tonight through Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 07 at 6:15AM AKDT until July 07 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR DELTANA AND TANANA FLATS... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 10 PM AKDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...From the Gerstle River to Dot Lake. * TIMING...From Noon today until 10 PM AKDT this evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 07 at 6:15AM AKDT until July 07 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR UPPER TANANA VALLEY AND THE FORTYMILE COUNTRY... entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued July 07 at 5:57AM AKDT until July 08 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...South winds 40 mph with gusts to 60 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range North of Black Rapids. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Heavy rainfall across Brooks Range and North Slope will result in rising water levels on streams and rivers. Rainfall totals of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are expected Friday evening through Saturday evening from the Colville River near Umiat east to the Ivishak River. Water levels will rise significantly and may approach
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Rivers Through the Weekend... Numerous rain showers through Saturday will cause rises on rivers and streams in the Western and Central Brooks Range through the weekend. Additional rainfall of 0.75 to 1.50 inches is expected through Saturday. People in this area should remain alert for the possibility of rising water levels through the weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures through Saturday... Confidence is increasing that a marine layer will develop along the coast through the weekend. This could cause daytime high temperatures to be lower than areas who do not see the marine layer develop. At this time there is a greater than 90 percent chance that temperatures will warm to the upper 60s along the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures Will Bring Rises to the Taiya River... As temperatures warm into the upper 70s and even low 80s on Friday, increased snow melt and glacial runoff will cause the Taiya River to rise. There still exist some uncertainty on how high the river could rise, but it is expected to remain within its banks. Looking into the weekend, there will still be warm temperatures in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures through Sunday... There is a high potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday. Friday will be the warmest day with a greater than 80 percent chance of communities seeing greater than 75 degrees. Warmest temperatures will occur
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Wrangell; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough
